intro: Hieracium cremnaeiforme, commonly known as the Balkan hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium cremnaeiforme is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of nutrient-rich environments.
